article.headline: Boston University 78, Harvard 74
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Tyler Morris scored 22 points and Corey Lowe added 14 Tuesday night as Boston University held off a late Harvard rally for a 78-74 win. Brian Cusworth tied his career high with 24 points for the Crimson (1-1). BU (1-1) made 11 of 26 shots from 3-point range and 13-14 free throws despite being outrebounded 37-29. Carlos Strong scored 13 points and Omari Peterson 11 for the Terriers. The Crimson turned the ball over 20 times, good for 29 BU points. Evan Harris added 12 points while Jim Goffredo and Brad Unger each scored 10 for Harvard. Harvard went on a 7-0 run during the last four minutes of the game to cut a nine-point BU lead to 71-69 on a Cusworth basket with 1:21 left in the game. But with two seconds left and the Crimson trailing 76-74, Drew Housman missed the second of two free throws. The Terriers' Ibrahim Konate grabbed the rebound and converted both of his free throws to seal the win. Peterson completed a 3-point play with 4:02 on the clock, opening the Terriers' biggest lead of the game at 71-62. Lowe made all four of his 3-pointers in the first half as BU took a 41-35 lead at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
